name: Le Chateau de Sully

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to Chateau de Sully having stayed there several years before in a tiny but lovely attic room in the top of the main building. We had fond memories of a very good restaurant, well used by local people for celebrations, with an exceptional selection of cheeses.
reviews.title: A bit disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly our second stay didn't live up to expectations. We were given a room in the annexe building which absolutely lacked any character. It was very sparsely furnished - just a couple of cushions handing from a rail above the bed in lieu of headboard! - and the pillows were very thin and lumpy. Nice bathroom though.
reviews.title: Beautiful chateau

reviews.text: The restaurant had changed beyond recognition. No local people in evidence - even though it was Friday night - and a menu that had sacrificed quality in favour of cleverness. I ordered some local langoustines to start and was disappointed to find three quite small shellfish, which at a cost of Euro24 for the dish meant they were Euro8 each. Not good value and much to my disappointment no cheeses to choose from - just four ready cut for service.
reviews.title: Very average stay

likes.liked: — The pool and spacious, private cottage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After our first visit I recommended this hotel to many friends but now would struggle to do so, not because there's anything wrong with it, but because in my mind it just didn't represent good value for money.
reviews.title: Strongly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had one night at this lovely property and truly enjoyed it. The chateau itself is gorgeous. The setting is truly pastoral with grazing cows & a charming herb garden. The drive up to the chateus is impressive and you know you're in for a treat which is confirmed at reception.
reviews.title: Nice Stay at Sully

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just finished a three night stay at Le Chateau de Sully and it was everything we might have hoped for. The rooms were not exceptional but were more than adequate. The staff were well informed and accomodating, while the grounds and common areas were outstanding. The restaurant was also quite excellent and able to make substitutions from the very limited menu. It proved to be a very convenient location for touring the D-Day sites and MSM and, after Paris and Honfleur, the price was reasonable. Lack of an elevator may make it difficult for some, but I would go back anytime.
reviews.title: Up to expectations

aka: Le Chateau De Sully Hotel Sully
